alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 11 at 2:58AM CDT until August 11 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma... Northeastern Le Flore County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 345 AM CDT. * At 258 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles west of Tamaha, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Sallisaw... Muldrow... Spiro... Panama... Keota... Bokoshe... Gans... Tamaha... Cowlington... Kanima... Scullyville... Cottonwood... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma near mile marker 300, and between mile markers 312 and 323. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
